Entries.default:
"You're looking better, casità. That or I'm worse off than I thought."

The sheen of sweat on her brow and the wan cast to her features belies Irrena's casual greeting.
"If you get a chance, casità. I'm not going anywhere."
"What happened?"
"I was a stubborn postenaga. I was trying to fasten this mess down when we struck shore. Barrel rolled right over my leg."
"Ah! It still hurts, but I can manage from here. Agracima."
[Cast Lay on Hands] "This is all I can do for now. We'll set it later."
[Craft a splint from some debris.] "I'll patch you up best as I can, but you'll want to stay off the leg as much as possible."
"Beodul said you had to bail him out of trouble. Di verus? Was he crying? You can tell me."
"Hang on. I'll carry you back down."
"Quite romantic, casità. I'll try not to hold it against you if you drop me."
[Ease her pain with a spell.]
[Leave] "I'll be back."
"Just look for the campfire."
"Not yet."
[Shrug.]
"That should be easy enough. I'll save you a spot."
"I'll start a fire. If any of the others are out there, hopefully they'll see it and turn up."
"I'm sure we'll be fine. I'll see you on shore, casità."
"If we had to run aground, at least it's somewhere with a view."
"I'll keep the campfire burning."
"It's my leg. Madiccho it hurts even worse than it looks." Irrena's leg bears a bloody gouge along the length of her shin, and the swelling around her knee suggests a nasty break.

"Don't suppose you're here to help?" 

She gives a nervous, breathless laugh, and glances down at her bloodied leg. Judging by the stiff way she's holding it, it's likely broken.
"Help! Somebody! Per complanca!"
"Everything we've been through, and I'm nearly done in by a cask of rum."

"I wasn't planning on going for a run, casità."

Irrena sighs in obvious relief as her pain subsides. She gives the leg a tentative stretch.

"I wasn't planning on going for a run, casità."

Irrena watches you work with obvious relief. Once you're through, she gives the leg a tentative stretch.
"Have you found any of the others yet?"
"Anybody out there?"
"Have you seen anyone else?"
"Funny thing. It's hard to see much from the underside of a barrel."
"There must be other survivors out there."
"Oh, quiet! You were under a damned barrel!"
